tldr: Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution due to improper sanitization of user input when dynamically generating code for cookie signing. The vulnerability exists because the `cookie.secrets` configuration is directly embedded into generated function code using string concatenation without proper escaping, allowing an attacker who can control this value to inject arbitrary JavaScript code.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `elysia` library to the patch version.
vulnerable_to: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
